commit_message:
Restructures authentication for resource providers

  Workflow to find credentials details from:
  1. The environment variables (ENV['OS_*'])
  2. If not enough, credentials available from the environment RC file
     to be used. Default RC file must be in current user homedir: ~/openrc

  - Adds module Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Auth providing class methods for
  providers instead of relying on superclass inheritance.
  As discussed [1], this purposefully removes the possibility to pass authenti-
  cation details as parameters to Puppet resources instances.

  - Wraps credentials information with object:
    Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Credentials

  - The credentials information is used in a withenv block

  Review for puppet-keystone needs to be merged at same time:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181299/

  [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/063352.html

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-04 02:00:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Fix _quota_reserve test setup for incompatible type checking

The db.quota_reserve() method expects to get project_quotas and
user_quotas as dicts that map resource types to limits which are ints.

The _quota_reserve test setup method was just mapping the resource type
to the Quota sqlalchemy dict-like object that was coming back from
db.quota_create. Since db._calculate_overquota compares the delta (int)
to the user_quotas/project_quotas value, which was a Quota object, and
py34 doesn't allow incompatible type checks like that, this fails with
py34.

This fixes the _quota_reserve test setup method to map the resource type
to the hard_limit like the actual DB APIs do in the normal nova.quota
flows.  It also has to adjust the setup method to avoid going over-quota
immediately due to the limit and usage being the same (which is why we
add a buffer to the i value for the limit).

Closes-Bug: #1461665

Change-Id: I9f5f537eff58fe83caa7bff2fb0800ce9f7272fa
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix _quota_reserve test setup for incompatible type checking

The db.quota_reserve() method expects to get project_quotas and
user_quotas as dicts that map resource types to limits which are ints.

The _quota_reserve test setup method was just mapping the resource type
to the Quota sqlalchemy dict-like object that was coming back from
db.quota_create. Since db._calculate_overquota compares the delta (int)
to the user_quotas/project_quotas value, which was a Quota object, and
py34 doesn't allow incompatible type checks like that, this fails with
py34.

This fixes the _quota_reserve test setup method to map the resource type
to the hard_limit like the actual DB APIs do in the normal nova.quota
flows.  It also has to adjust the setup method to avoid going over-quota
immediately due to the limit and usage being the same (which is why we
add a buffer to the i value for the limit).

Closes-Bug: #1461665

Change-Id: I9f5f537eff58fe83caa7bff2fb0800ce9f7272fa

When running devstack, the following syntax error comes out

> /opt/stack/networking-odl/devstack/settings.odl: line 42: ODL_KARAF_LOG_BASE: screen-karaf.log: syntax error: invalid arithmetic operator (error token is ".log")

commit_message:
devstack: unzip -u may wait for user input

When there is an existing opendaylight package expanded,
unzip -u may wait for user input without any input.
For automation, it should overwrite without prompting.
So -o (overwrite existing files without prompting) should be
used for zunip.

Change-Id: Ic85ba531797a4f394bb8e47222bd97dc9300f65d
Closes-Bug: #1463558

commit_message:
devstack: OFFLINE=True is ignored

Even if OFFLINE=True, plugin.sh tries to access to the internet.
It shouldn't download any from the internet when OFFLINE=True.
As a bonus, it doesn't update opendaylight karaf package when
unnecessary.

Closes-Bug: #1463529
Change-Id: I38ead6e9c8738ed6979f07fedaeb0bf88d5f3e86

commit_message:
Modify GetResourceErrorStatus exception

Variable "fault" was not used in exception message. It produced unclear
error messages, like:
   Resource <Server: rally_novaserver_aKO6sw5xHdOPZbEC> has ERROR status:

The end of such messages looks unfinished.

Proposed change removes this variable from exception message at all.

Change-Id: Ic27ace0fdc6eea2ee8d437fc2a0efc10d0b8e960

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-17 12:23:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script failed) or to BACKUP
state (script successful).

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-17 12:25:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a

(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script failed) or to BACKUP
state (script successful).

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461
Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-02-17 12:27:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script failed) or to BACKUP
state (script successful).

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

The scripts allow the user to cause VRRP fail-over once
an event has/hasn't occurred for 2 consecutive checks in a row.

Closes-Bug: #1365461
Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171

", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-02-18 06:59:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script returned '0') or 
to BACKUP state (script returned value other then '0').

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461
DocImpact:
The 'l3_agent.ini' config file can take a parameter
'ha_health_check_script_path' which should contain a 
full path to a bash script that behaves as detailed 
in the commit message.
Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171

", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-02-18 07:52:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to either
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail) or to BACKUP state (script
exited with '0' - success).

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171
", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-02-19 06:35:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adding support for Keepalived health check script.

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code '0' (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran every 'interval' seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.

value other then '0' - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code '0' (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran according to the new
'ha_health_check_script_interval' parameter in
'l3_agent.ini'. This parameter has a default value of
5 seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_interval' which will determine
the VRRP health check interval in seconds.

commit_message:
Adding support for Keepalived health check script

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code '0' (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran according to the new
'ha_health_check_script_interval' parameter in
'l3_agent.ini'. This parameter has a default value of
5 seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_interval' which will determine
the VRRP health check interval in seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1365461

Change-Id: I43b285e164f346b7b7f2ab99bc3272e2527cf171

commit_message:
Test IP allocation in two SLAAC subnets

Test creates two stateless IPv6 subnets and check that each IP in
these subnets is SLAAC and calculated from MAC address.
DDT support was added according to agreement with Marc and Mathew

Closes-Bug: 1358709
Change-Id: Id6476923d527830123a8a3a650e24fb59ad15dde

commit_message:
Anuta NCX mechanism driver

This driver acts as a proxy for plugin that runs inside the NCX server.
This driver simply redirects the network, subnet and port action payload to NCX server using NCX RestAPI.

Change-Id: I62d8ba3db0215a8746c5d34c198a9d06aad7d9ce
Implements: NCX mechanism driver

commit_message:
Add service group as a firewall customized service

This patch introduces reference implementation,
currently firewall rule can refer multiple service groups to allow the
user flexibilty to define their own groups and use them without impacting
the other users.

More info can be found at service group wiki
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/FWaaS/FWaaS-ServiceGroup
Implements: blueprint fwaas-customized-service for customized service
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>

Change-Id: I18f69917027f2c5ba3f00fbacb1c8a242c8cf06f

commit_message:
To give proper reason during delete-port with VIP associated

When an VIP is associated with particular subnet and when an port is
deleted, 500 internal server error is thrown. This fix will give
proper error message.

Closes-Bug: #1430394
Change-Id: I28bdb7f3bf4219ec9856d8a89d73b1bdfce8fb38

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-30 20:26:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP delay fip namespace cleanup/destroy

The agent_gateway_port and fip-ns are shared resources
across ext-networds and routers for a given agent.  While
debugging intermittent failures on the dvr experimental
job, traces indicate there may be a race condition between
when these shared resources are beeing added and deleted.

This patch does 2 things to debug and resolve the race
condition:
1. Delays destroying the objects via fullsync
2. Validates destroying the namespace by scanning for
remaining ports.

This patch is very much a WIP and is mostly being used
to isolate the race condition above.

Related-bug: #1415522

commit_message:
delay fip namespace cleanup/destroy

The agent_gateway_port and fip-ns are shared resources
across ext-networks and routers for a given agent.  While
debugging intermittent failures on the dvr experimental
job, traces indicate there may be a race condition between
when these shared resources are beeing added and deleted.

This patch does the following to debug and resolve the race
condition:
1. Delays destroying the objects via fullsync for FIP
delete or dissassociate.  Router delete is the only
other time when the fip namespace will possibly be destroyed.
This should reduce the churn of port and ns creation and
deletion.
2. Validates destroying the namespace by checking the
fip_ns object subscribe list.  This list is used by
any router which uses the fip_ns object.

Related-bug: #1415522

Change-Id: Iade09e4d3ae329e5c9d3c70ac9802b262b9f727f

This change defines TcNatDriver: driver to manage tc-based (stateless)
nat and neutron.agent.linux.tc_lib module. This module provides low
level drivers to manage ingress/egress nat filters in tc.

Stateless nat doesn't support to reach natted ports/vms from internal
networks using their floating ips because stateless nat is not able to
differentiate natted/non-natted traffics (it always rewrites natted
ports/vms egress traffics). A follow-up change will define an hybrid nat
driver to use stateless nat for north/south traffic and stateful nat for
east/west traffic.

commit_message:
Define TcNatDriver stateless nat driver

This change defines TcNatDriver: driver to manage tc-based (stateless)
nat and neutron.agent.linux.tc_lib module. This module provides low
level drivers to manage ingress/egress nat filters in tc.

Stateless nat doesn't support to reach natted ports/vms from internal
networks using their floating ips because stateless nat is not able to
differentiate natted/non-natted traffics (it always rewrites natted
ports/vms egress traffics). A follow-up change will define an hybrid nat
driver to use stateless nat for north/south traffic and stateful nat for
east/west traffic.

Related-Bug: #1334926
Partially-Implements: blueprint stateless-floatingips
Change-Id: Id2e8c084381c8552e7f8641724ca083aaa23cb01

commit_message:
Update post_test_hook to use run-tox.sh

Proposed modifications to project-config's run-tox.sh script are
intended to allow reuse by non-unit test jobs.  This change updates
neutron's post_test_hook.sh script to use run-tox.sh to reuse the
testr artifact processing that it defines.

Change-Id: I8fff14c02c35e34efef4bdc523f7fea60391cfa1
Depends-On: Ia69f0bef031b33265d508e6a47cc8fb294cb4830

commit_message:
Fix vlan segementation id out of range of config_file bug

When creating vlan network, vlan id is not in vlan range of config
file, neutron server will create success.

Checking vlan segementation id with neutron config file,
then raise an exception.

Change-Id: Ib9d9faa9b010e75d2be0ceca41704c6b41fe72eb
Closes-Bug: #1449526

commit_message:
Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074

subject: Enable udev for lvm in cinder-volume container
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 10:30:40.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/vars/config_vars/container_config_cinder_volume.yml', 'rpc_deployment/playbooks/openstack/cinder-volume.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/templates/lvm.conf'], 'message': "Enable udev for lvm in cinder-volume container

The current configuration of LVM for cinder-volume has udev_sync=0.
This means that udev is not creating the devices that appear in /dev.
The device files created reference specific device numbers, and these
persist between reboots. When the host is rebooted there is no
guarantee that device numbers allocated to the logical volumes will
match those defined in the device files. This can be observed by
comparing the output of 'dmsetup info' and 'ls -l /dev/mapper'.

LVM's use of udev was disabled in an attempt to protect the host from
the potential that uevents generated would be processed by all
containers on the host. In practise this should not be an issue because
there are not other containers running on a cinder host.

This commit adjusts the lvm.conf file created so that udev is used. It
also adds a mount entry to create a devtmpfs on /dev. Finally
'udevadm trigger' is run to add the devices under /dev/mapper.

(cherry picked from commit 389b0f0dd886388fefae0cece2844c35da28e405)

Closes-Bug: #1436999
Change-Id: I9ab35cf4438a369563f8c08870c1acfd0cc394b0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable udev for lvm in cinder-volume container

The current configuration of LVM for cinder-volume has udev_sync=0.
This means that udev is not creating the devices that appear in /dev.
The device files created reference specific device numbers, and these
persist between reboots. When the host is rebooted there is no
guarantee that device numbers allocated to the logical volumes will
match those defined in the device files. This can be observed by
comparing the output of 'dmsetup info' and 'ls -l /dev/mapper'.

LVM's use of udev was disabled in an attempt to protect the host from
the potential that uevents generated would be processed by all
containers on the host. In practise this should not be an issue because
there are not other containers running on a cinder host.

This commit adjusts the lvm.conf file created so that udev is used. It
also adds a mount entry to create a devtmpfs on /dev. Finally
'udevadm trigger' is run to add the devices under /dev/mapper.

(cherry picked from commit 389b0f0dd886388fefae0cece2844c35da28e405)

commit_message:
Fix $this usage in horizon.tables.js

In horizon.tables.js there are a couple of places where
$(this) is called multiple times in the same function. This
isn't optimal and is corrected by this patch.

Change-Id: I7c644c3dbf96c2958ec351024d7f37a30448c44e
Closes-Bug: 1463501

commit_message:
Port exception_to_str() to Python 3

On Python 3, exception messages are unicode strings. There is no need to
decode them.

Skip the test on the "ignore" error handler on Python 3, it's specific
to Python 2.

Change-Id: Ieec9e1e1f7a0fc901271fd74eca357fe1cf6a975

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2

commit_message:
Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074
(cherry picked from commit ecbf4d2bb878b6b6037ee54f195182e46297e85d)

commit_message:
import error by l3_odl

tox -e py27 fails as follows.
This is because importing common_db_mixin from db_base_plugin_v2 was removed,
by the change set of ece8cc2e9aae1610a325d0c206e38da3da9a0a1a,
by the change id of I1eac61c258541bca80e14be4b7c75519a014ffae

commit_message:
Include links to developer workflow documentation

Newcomers aren't always sure how to get started with our tools or
workflow. Lucky for them, we have documented these things. Unlucky for
them, they have no idea the docs exist.

Give them some links.

Change-Id: I6fce6fbccb8a9fe16b48845790b4cac05317ebac

commit_message:
Make 'echo' work in the 'venv' environment

Our documentation uses the example of:
    tox -evenv -- echo 'done'

Which fails with the error:
    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
      cmd: /usr/bin/echo
      env: /home/john/openstack/ironic/.tox/venv
    Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?

This fixes that issue.

Change-Id: I9beeea1887ed6abfe3e319598cd687b6c6229bac

commit_message:
Make 'echo' work in the 'venv' environment

Our documentation uses the example of:
    tox -evenv -- echo 'done'

Which fails with the error:
    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
      cmd: /usr/bin/echo
      env: /home/john/openstack/ironic/.tox/venv
    Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?

This fixes that issue.

Change-Id: Iec7d24f72f1c8eec90a5c4a5d6ff099f698fd7b5

Change auth_url to identity_uri

identity_uri, also add auth_rui configuration.

commit_message:
Encapsulate Service Providers in AccessInfo

This patch adds the support for the AccessInfo object to return the
list of Service Providers encapsulated in a class that provides methods
to access URL attributes from each service provider present in the list.

Change-Id: I7f5ed8c5cb64482eb2d8cf98a8eba33f483eb88d
Closes-Bug: 1459702

commit_message:
Prevent multiple form submission on table row actions

This disables any table row actions that do a form submit after an
action is taken and the form is being submitted. It also changes the
cursor to make it clear an action is taking place.

Closes-Bug: #1433849
Change-Id: I004f0ae43e5201eba30ff38a34be680416407fbc
(cherry picked from commit ea2f6b35da70d7a9d3f441553dac0f88f6ef9218)

attempt to connect insecurely.

Closes-bug: 1447784

Add Heat stack CRUD

commit_message:
Redo auth plugins

There are a number of changes here to better align OSC with how the
other clients are expecting to use the keystoneclient auth plugins.

Firstly I think it is a bad idea to Combine all the options from every
available plugin into the --help. There are plugins recently for example
for federation that have a bunch of possible options that are going to
polute this space with options that are not relevant for most people.

Instead of this define a default plugin that handles the options that
were initially available to OSC. Additional options were added in a
recent change however they have not yet been in a release. If we want to
extend the available options for OSC then those options can be added to
the default plugin.

Change-Id: I759cfb2e3989c1abd5cd49826eb136a60427239e

subject: [WIP] Allow export and reuse of Token and Endpoint URLS
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-23 16:42:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v2_0/token.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': '[WIP] Allow export and reuse of Token and Endpoint URLS

Add function which allows usage of OpenStack client
where token and catalog is obtained once, then reused for
subsequent commands.

By adding 'export auth' action, which has output
like 'export OS_TOKEN="..."; export OS_URL="..."'
so it can be sourced to current shell.

To handle multiple service-type endpoints
it uses OS_<type=COMPUTE,IDENTITY,...>_URL variables.

Example usage could be:
> source my_user_creds
> eval $(openstack export auth)  # uses auth_url+user+pass+...
> openstack network list  # uses token+endpoint_url
> openstack volume list  # uses token+endpoint_url
> ...

Change-Id: I2959fe68aef57434c87c96a03e350e359f2e2dd0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Allow export and reuse of Token and Endpoint URLS

Add function which allows usage of OpenStack client
where token and catalog is obtained once, then reused for
subsequent commands.

By adding 'export auth' action, which has output
like 'export OS_TOKEN="..."; export OS_URL="..."'
so it can be sourced to current shell.

To handle multiple service-type endpoints
it uses OS_<type=COMPUTE,IDENTITY,...>_URL variables.

Example usage could be:
> source my_user_creds
> eval $(openstack export auth)  # uses auth_url+user+pass+...
> openstack network list  # uses token+endpoint_url
> openstack volume list  # uses token+endpoint_url
> ...

Change-Id: I2959fe68aef57434c87c96a03e350e359f2e2dd0

commit_message:
Refactor awkward logic in setup_dhcp_port

I noticed this logic as I was reviewing another patch set [1].  I
didn't like removing subnet ids from dhcp_enabled_subnet_ids and I
wasn't too keen on the ips_need_removal semantics that were kind of
forced by the existing structure of the code.  I hope you find this
alternative much clearer.  I like straight-forward code with less
indentation that doesn't use awkward booleans like ips_needs_removal.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157697/6

Change-Id: I8bd3d6924a855ea08f8096e66bd3bfbb165a4da3

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 21:12:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Handle modals properly when disabling table actions

This fixes a problem when attempting to disable table actions on
a modal dialog. It causes the Launch Instance modal to render
incorrectly and other modals result in a
"$form.on is not a function" error displayed in the browser
console. This is because the modal init function is assuming the
argument passed in is a jQuery reference to the modal but in
reality it is just the modal DOM node itself. The problem is fixed
by making a jQuery reference to the modal before preparing to
disable the actions of any tables that might be displayed on it.

Closes-Bug: #1462544
Change-Id: I56399468ff5e2b5bcd0b285ece0d6dd001500c24
(cherry picked from commit 54ee33c4d844961f7f7f7d94b3c298a015b09e95)

This fixes a problem when attempting to disable table actions on
a modal dialog. It causes the Launch Instance modal to render
incorrectly and other modals result in a
"$form.on is not a function" error displayed in the browser
console. This is because the modal init function is assuming the
argument passed in is a jQuery reference to the modal but in
reality it is just the modal DOM node itself. The problem is fixed
by making a jQuery reference to the modal before preparing to
disable the actions of any tables that might be displayed on it.

Closes-Bug: #1462544
Change-Id: I56399468ff5e2b5bcd0b285ece0d6dd001500c24
(cherry picked from commit 54ee33c4d844961f7f7f7d94b3c298a015b09e95)
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Prevent multiple form submission on table row actions

This disables any table row actions that do a form submit after an
action is taken and the form is being submitted. It also changes the
cursor to make it clear an action is taking place.

Closes-Bug: #1433849
Change-Id: I004f0ae43e5201eba30ff38a34be680416407fbc
(cherry picked from commit ea2f6b35da70d7a9d3f441553dac0f88f6ef9218)

Handle modals properly when disabling table actions

This fixes a problem when attempting to disable table actions on
a modal dialog. It causes the Launch Instance modal to render
incorrectly and other modals result in a
"$form.on is not a function" error displayed in the browser
console. This is because the modal init function is assuming the
argument passed in is a jQuery reference to the modal but in
reality it is just the modal DOM node itself. The problem is fixed
by making a jQuery reference to the modal before preparing to
disable the actions of any tables that might be displayed on it.

Closes-Bug: #1462544
Change-Id: I56399468ff5e2b5bcd0b285ece0d6dd001500c24
(cherry picked from commit 54ee33c4d844961f7f7f7d94b3c298a015b09e95)

commit_message:
Adding verbose flag

This commit adds a -v, verbose flag to Bandit.  Previously
included and excluded files were listed in output every time,
which made the output long and annoying.

This adds a -v flag to list the included and excluded files in
text mode output (for example) but it is passed to the instance of
result store, so output formatters can use it how they want.

Change-Id: I4ed44c5d2635f7dd1d465b6cf0942c7633ec7862

commit_message:
Bump stable/kilo release

been tagged at 2015.1(.0), hence the complains. This patch

commit_message:
Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074

commit_message:
Escape the description param from heat template

The heat template allows user to define custom parameters,
the fields are then converted to input fields. The description
param maps to the help_text attribute of the field.

Since the value comes from the user, the value must be escaped
before rendering.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I79d540a8363b2507c4bccdc0cc38e283962919d2
Closes-bug: #1453074

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 128, 'name': 'David Medberry', 'email': 'openstack@medberry.net', 'username': 'med'}, {'_account_id': 2276, 'name': 'Jorge Niedbalski', 'email': 'jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com', 'username': 'niedbalski'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 10540, 'name': "Clayton O'Neill", 'email': 'clayton.oneill@charter.com', 'username': 'coneill'}, {'_account_id': 11356, 'name': 'Louis Taylor', 'email': 'louis@kragniz.eu', 'username': 'kragniz'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 14:50:32.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'glance/schema.py'], 'message': "Return empty str for permissive, none, properties

In Kilo, a patch landed to allow glance for returning None values. While
this was not an issue for the base and registered properties in the
`schema-image.json` file, it did break backwards compatibility for the
custom images created in V1 that have a vulue equal to None.

In order to restore compatibility, this changes returns empty strings
for those custom properties that exist in the database but that are not
part of the V2 schema. This strategy will help migrating such properties
when updates to the image data happens and it'll be a noop for just
reads.

We can't use a schema migration because we don't know off hand which of
the properties in the database are the ones that would need to be
migrated.

While we could skip this properties entirely, this patch prefers to send
the empty string back as a way to create awareness on the fact that
there's an empty property in the database. Since we didn't use to return
these properties, we can assume they weren't being used.

Closes-bug: #1419823
Change-Id: I59bb27a892fe9485fc98a612ca0148a84123f5a2
(cherry picked from commit ccea7b68567afb2d5bb825d0cabf247a9526bd93)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Return empty str for permissive, none, properties

In Kilo, a patch landed to allow glance for returning None values. While
this was not an issue for the base and registered properties in the
`schema-image.json` file, it did break backwards compatibility for the
custom images created in V1 that have a vulue equal to None.

In order to restore compatibility, this changes returns empty strings
for those custom properties that exist in the database but that are not
part of the V2 schema. This strategy will help migrating such properties
when updates to the image data happens and it'll be a noop for just
reads.

We can't use a schema migration because we don't know off hand which of
the properties in the database are the ones that would need to be
migrated.

While we could skip this properties entirely, this patch prefers to send
the empty string back as a way to create awareness on the fact that
there's an empty property in the database. Since we didn't use to return
these properties, we can assume they weren't being used.

Closes-bug: #1419823
Change-Id: I59bb27a892fe9485fc98a612ca0148a84123f5a2
(cherry picked from commit ccea7b68567afb2d5bb825d0cabf247a9526bd93)

Change-Id: Idbdfa1f36015b6af347d1ce27eb28baa360af5ef
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Increase OpenStack DomU usage again

Devstack has continued to grow in memory requirements and now we cannot
reliably fit in 4GB, with several services being unable to start.  Increase
the minimum for DomU to 6GB to leave room for virtual machines

Change-Id: Idbdfa1f36015b6af347d1ce27eb28baa360af5ef

commit_message:
validate_token returns AccessInfo

The keystoneclient token validation methods return AccessInfo
instances. Clean up the code structure by keeping the AccessInfo as
it is rather than converting it right away.

Further work will utilize the AccessInfo in other parts of
auth_token directly rather than converting it.

Change-Id: I9f9c6f7bf0b99f6d37e3bf41ebe0c50cbe54e0db

subject: Fix nova and glance discovery URLs when tls-proxy is enabled.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-05 17:57:06.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova', 'lib/glance'], 'message': 'Fix nova and glance discovery URLs when tls-proxy is enabled.

Retrieving the root page in the nova and glance APIs include
URLs for the various versions supported. These are by default
reported using unsecure URLs. Configure the services to report
a SSL-based URL instead.

Change-Id: I220757e53b94a5f6d19291371407220fdf54c645
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix nova and glance discovery URLs when tls-proxy is enabled.

Retrieving the root page in the nova and glance APIs include
URLs for the various versions supported. These are by default
reported using unsecure URLs. Configure the services to report
a SSL-based URL instead.

commit_message:
Add get_communication_params interface to plugins

To allow authentication plugins such as using client certificates or
doing kerberos authentication with every request we need a way for the
plugins to manipulate the send parameters.

Change-Id: Ib9e81773ab988ea05869bc27097d2b25e963e59c
Blueprint: generic-plugins

commit_message:
fix redstack failing

Let redstack proceed if /opt/stack is missing. Change redstack to only
fail if explicitly told to.
Also proceed if devstack already exists. Enable the client plugin.

Change-Id: I9f3a0a19306e4a42bdae1349b4a6de77199ef835
Closes-Bug: #1460132

commit_message:
Adds support to set admin password from the cli

You can set admin password as
nova boot --image <image> --flavor <flavor> --admin-pass <pass> vm-name

Change-Id: I119aba428c15d736e64d990be47cc5c13bb83738
Closes-Bug: #1248517

commit_message:
Deprecate use-syslog-rfc-format for removal

During J dev cycle the default logging format for syslog
was supposed to be changed to always provide APP-NAME for log messages.
It looks like the valid deprecation procedure was missed, so this
patch introduces it as appropriate:
* Deprecate for removal use-syslog-rfc-format since J dev cycle
  ended and we should follow the accepted decision.

DocImpact
Related-bug: #904307

Change-Id: Ic2e5bd127c9f3a0f2807a25f29d8693baf3d65f2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup various inaccuracies in the README.rst

There was a mention of v1.1, a version-specific import, omission of
the required version argument creating a Client object, an irrelevant
comment, use of service_type implying the ability to use novaclient
with services other than nova (we have deprecated use of the volume
endpoint, for example), and a misspelling.

Change-Id: I91b2aa4001295e152883134326f40f887a55cc50

commit_message:
Mark task as failed in case of flow failure

When a taskflow flow fails at an intermediate task before complete
task, the glance task is in the processing state indefinitely. This
patch marks the task as failed.

In addition, it also fixes the importToFS task to properly analyze
the taskflow result object.

Closes-Bug: #1459015

Change-Id: Icd325c87bac5a48ea177cfa883a173c3c490feb2

The cinder-pylint check doesn't work with the proposal-bot
tag merges and causes said changes to be blocked.

This patch makes the pylint checks in Cinder non-voting
temporarily until we either fix things up and make it work
properly, or decide to remove it altogether.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make gate-cinder-pylint non-voting

The cinder-pylint check doesn't work with the proposal-bot
tag merges and causes said changes to be blocked.

This patch makes the pylint checks in Cinder non-voting
temporarily until we either fix things up and make it work
properly, or decide to remove it altogether.

Have opened LP# 1463530 against Cinder to address this.

Change-Id: Ie29d6dd42706b1833309c6af70951076685bbb96

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-30 10:54:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'correct api schema for instance patch

The api schema specification for the patch oepration is in error and
defined a parameter of "configuration_id" while the code (both in the
server and the client, and also all the tests) used "configuration".

A fix with fewer lines of code would have been to just embed the {
"type": "null" } into the definition of configuration_id but I am
going to be making additional changes to the way in which we signal
(through a put call) that we want to detach a configuration_id so I've
defined a null_configuration_id type which I can use there as
well.

To prevent this from reoccuring, additionalProperties has been set to
False.

Change-Id: Ic98050e487b0d8cd9a68e8c46169456a52e2b16c
Closes-Bug: #1460174

commit_message:
correct api schema for instance patch

The api schema specification for the patch oepration is in error and
defined a parameter of "configuration_id" while the code (both in the
server and the client, and also all the tests) used "configuration".

A fix with fewer lines of code would have been to just embed the {
"type": "null" } into the definition of configuration_id but I am
going to be making additional changes to the way in which we signal
(through a put call) that we want to detach a configuration_id so I've
defined a null_configuration_id type which I can use there as
well.

To prevent this from reoccuring, additionalProperties has been set to
False.

Change-Id: Ic98050e487b0d8cd9a68e8c46169456a52e2b16c
Closes-Bug: #1460174

the wrong string and not test what we think we're testing.

Make conductor use instance object

Because the instance itself was guaranteed to be objects
we can make all instance usage to be object.

[{'created': '2015-06-09 10:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/api/test_extensions.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/etc/neutron.conf', 'neutron/tests/base.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Make pep8 job succeed when /etc/neutron/neutron.conf is not installed

Currently, if /etc/neutron/neutron.conf is not installed in the system,
neutron-db-manage fails in oslo.config code when trying to determine the
default configuration file to use.

Test job should not rely on any contents inside /etc/.

Instead, pass --config-file with test-only configuration explicitly into
the utility.

neutron.conf.test was renamed into neutron.conf since for some reason
oslo.config does not support a name that does not have .conf at its
filename end.

Change-Id: I719829fc83a7b20a49c338aaf1dbef916dcc768c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make pep8 job succeed when /etc/neutron/neutron.conf is not installed

Currently, if /etc/neutron/neutron.conf is not installed in the system,
neutron-db-manage fails in oslo.config code when trying to determine the
default configuration file to use.

Test job should not rely on any contents inside /etc/.

Instead, pass --config-file with test-only configuration explicitly into
the utility.

neutron.conf.test was renamed into neutron.conf since for some reason
oslo.config does not support a name that does not have .conf at its
filename end.

Change-Id: I719829fc83a7b20a49c338aaf1dbef916dcc768c

commit_message:

Fix the documentation string for _create_snapshot() function.
Added detailed doc for volume in-use and available scenarios for the
snapshot deletion cases.

commit_message:
Support host-attach of volumes

This patch adds the host_name optional argument to attach API
in order to enable users of cinderclient to attach volumes
not only to the instances but also to the hosts.

The API interface is implemented in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34125/ .

Change-Id: I0ff8ef19d1e3073fee1b9ec0f60609c37dfab9ab
Implements: blueprint host-attach

[{'created': '2015-06-02 22:25:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Don't delete port from bridge on delete_port event

Commit d6a55c17360d1aa8ca91849199987ae71e8600ee added
logic to the OVS agent to delete a port from the integration
bridge when a port was deleted on the Neutron side. However,
this led to several races where whoever created the initial
port (e.g. Nova, L3 agent, DHCP agent) would be trying to
remove the port from the bridge at the same time. These
would result in ugly exceptions on one side or the other.

The original commit was trying to address the problem where
the port would maintain connectivity even though it was removed
from the integration bridge.

This patch addresses both cases by removing the iptables rules
for the deleted port and putting it in the dead VLAN so it loses
connectivity. However, it still leaves the port attached to the
integration bridge so the original creator can delete it.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py

commit_message:
Don't delete port from bridge on delete_port event

Commit d6a55c17360d1aa8ca91849199987ae71e8600ee added
logic to the OVS agent to delete a port from the integration
bridge when a port was deleted on the Neutron side. However,
this led to several races where whoever created the initial
port (e.g. Nova, L3 agent, DHCP agent) would be trying to
remove the port from the bridge at the same time. These
would result in ugly exceptions on one side or the other.

The original commit was trying to address the problem where
the port would maintain connectivity even though it was removed
from the integration bridge.

This patch addresses both cases by removing the iptables rules
for the deleted port and putting it in the dead VLAN so it loses
connectivity. However, it still leaves the port attached to the
integration bridge so the original creator can delete it.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py

Related-Bug: #1333365
Closes-Bug: #1448148
Change-Id: I7ae7750b7ac7d15325ed9f2d517ca171543b53be
(cherry picked from commit e007167a700aa5b80ecb48adff0ac36bb330591d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-05 14:06:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "objects: fix parsing of NUMA cpu/mem properties

When processing hw_numa_cpus.NN/hw_numa_mem.NN properties, the
ImageMetaProps object iterates from 0 through to the value of
hw_numa_nodes. If any NN is missing, it leaves it uninitialized.

This is wrong on two counts, first the hw_numa_nodes value is
not required to be set in the image - it can come from the
flavor, so we must not rely on it existing. Second, setting
of sparse topologies is not supported - all nodes must be
specified.

Change to iterate from 0 through to NUMA_NODES_MAX, defaulting
to 128 for now since that ought to be large enough for a good
few 10's of years to come. Stop reading at the first node for
which no data is present.

Change-Id: I2155164ad59a9b68245071d48d9dd501b76f7499

commit_message:
objects: fix parsing of NUMA cpu/mem properties

When processing hw_numa_cpus.NN/hw_numa_mem.NN properties, the
ImageMetaProps object iterates from 0 through to the value of
hw_numa_nodes. If any NN is missing, it leaves it uninitialized.

This is wrong on two counts, first the hw_numa_nodes value is
not required to be set in the image - it can come from the
flavor, so we must not rely on it existing. Second, setting
of sparse topologies is not supported - all nodes must be
specified.

Change to iterate from 0 through to NUMA_NODES_MAX, defaulting
to 128 for now since that ought to be large enough for a good
few 10's of years to come. Stop reading at the first node for
which no data is present.

Change-Id: I2155164ad59a9b68245071d48d9dd501b76f7499

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-01 16:37:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "compute: remove get_image_metadata method

The get_image_metadata method has some unhelpful semantics
where it takes the image metadata from the instance's
system metadata record, and then overwrites it with the
current metadata associated with the original image.

The result is that, if the image metadata in glance was
changed after the instance was first booted, Nova will
end up making decisions based on image metadata that does
not correspond to that which the instance was booted with.
Since the image metadata controls many aspects of hardware
configuration, this could lead to incorrect behaviour when
modifying hardware later, eg disk/vif/pci hotplug.

What is worse, is that some of the nova operations will
update the instance system metadata when completed, thus
permanently overwriting the original image metadata with
the new data.

Almost all code which operates against an existing instance
is updated to use nova.utils.get_image_from_system_metadata.
The exception is the rescue codepath, which must use the
metadata associated with the new rescue image.

The nova.compute.utils.get_image_metadata method can thus
be removed from use, avoiding the problematic logic.

Closes-bug: #1460079
Change-Id: I35c9d26e3967e93a2c368c3f9fdc807a69816dd2

commit_message:
compute: remove get_image_metadata method

The get_image_metadata method has some unhelpful semantics
where it takes the image metadata from the instance's
system metadata record, and then overwrites it with the
current metadata associated with the original image.

The result is that, if the image metadata in glance was
changed after the instance was first booted, Nova will
end up making decisions based on image metadata that does
not correspond to that which the instance was booted with.
Since the image metadata controls many aspects of hardware
configuration, this could lead to incorrect behaviour when
modifying hardware later, eg disk/vif/pci hotplug.

What is worse, is that some of the nova operations will
update the instance system metadata when completed, thus
permanently overwriting the original image metadata with
the new data.

Almost all code which operates against an existing instance
is updated to use nova.utils.get_image_from_system_metadata.
The exception is the rescue codepath, which must use the
metadata associated with the new rescue image.

The nova.compute.utils.get_image_metadata method can thus
be removed from use, avoiding the problematic logic.

Closes-bug: #1460079
Change-Id: I35c9d26e3967e93a2c368c3f9fdc807a69816dd2

of the compute API _create_image() method, and into nova.utils.

original location.

commit_message:
compute: only use non_inheritable_image_properties if snapshotting

The CONF.non_inheritable_image_properties parameter lists a set of
image metadata properties that should be discarded when uploading
an image to glance during the snapshotting process.

This property is currently applied in the nova.utils method
get_image_from_system_metadata(), which causes the properties in
question to be discarded in a wide variety of non-snapshotting
related operations.

This is a regression caused by two commits:

  commit 8e575be75c80ea71a6ad8fb73e6ace1ed708938f
  Author: Xavier Queralt <xqueralt@redhat.com>
  Date: Mon Aug 26 22:53:03 2013 +0200

    Add methods to get image metadata from instance

  commit 4389f2292a0177c8eedc0a398ceb3c5535a9ef82
  Author: Xavier Queralt <xqueralt@redhat.com>
  Date: Mon Aug 26 22:55:46 2013 +0200

    Avoid errors on some actions when image not usable

Which moved handling of CONF.non_inheritable_image_properties out
of the compute API _create_image() method, and into nova.utils.

Fix this by moving the handing back into the compute API in its
original location.

Closes-bug: #1459760
Change-Id: Id630fe68678c4aa469ddbfdb3c757b264519e918

commit_message:
objects: add os_require_quiesce image property

The compute api and libvirt driver both use the image meta
property os_require_quiesce to determine if snapshots are
permitted without quiescing the guest filesystems. This
was missed from the original ImageMetaProps object impl.

Change-Id: Iebf77be0db01ffd740c1c7560fc57c7ab91ae632

commit_message:
Update docs for usage of python-ironicclient

The virtualenv in the python-ironicclient now installs the 'ironic'
program by default into the bin directory of the 'venv' environment.  It
is no longer needed to manually call setup.py

Remove that line from the instructions.

Change-Id: I25fffa41cb4e806d20484ce3423943c91d8ca38e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-19 22:57:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove get_admin_roles and associated logic

get_admin_roles was introduced so that contextes generated from
within plugins could be used for policy checks. This was the case
up to the Havana release as several plugins invoked the policy
engine directly to authorize requests.

This was an incorrect behaviour and has now been fixed, meaning
that get_admin_roles is no longer need and can be safely removed.
This will result in a leaner and more reliable codebase. Indeed the
function being removed here was the cause of several bugs where the
policy engine was initialized too early in the server bootstrap
process.

As a consequence neutron's will now no longer perform policy checks
when context.is_admin=True. This flag is instead set either when
a context is explicitly created for granting admin privileges, or
when Neutron is operating in noauth mode. In the latter case every
request is treated by neutron as an admin request, and get_admin_roles
is simply ensuring the appropriate roles get pushed into the context
so that the policy engine will grant admin rights to the request.
This behaviour is probably just a waste of resource; also it is not
adding anything from a security perspective.

On the other hand not performing checks when context.is_admin is
True should not pose a security threat either in noauth mode or
with the keystone middleware. In the former case the software keeps
operating assuming admin rights fro every requests, whereas in the
latter case the keystone middleware will always supply a context
with the appropriate roles, and there is no way for an attacker
to trick keystonemiddleware into generating a context for which
is_admin=True.

This patch also does some non-trivial cheanges in test_l3.py as
some texts where mocking context.to_dict ignoring the is_admin flag.

Closes-Bug: #1446021

Change-Id: I8a5c02712a0b43f3e36a4f14620ebbd73fbfb03f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-20 10:59:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove get_admin_roles and associated logic

get_admin_roles was introduced so that contextes generated from
within plugins could be used for policy checks. This was the case
up to the Havana release as several plugins invoked the policy
engine directly to authorize requests.

This was an incorrect behaviour and has now been fixed, meaning
that get_admin_roles is no longer need and can be safely removed.
This will result in a leaner and more reliable codebase. Indeed the
function being removed here was the cause of several bugs where the
policy engine was initialized too early in the server bootstrap
process.
While this patch removes the feaute is does not remove the
load_admin_roles parameter from context.get_admin_context. Doing so
will break other projects such as neutron-lbaas. The parameter is
preserved albeit ignored, and will be remove once projects consuming
neutron are adjusted accordingly.

As a consequence neutron's will now no longer perform policy checks
when context.is_admin=True. This flag is instead set either when
a context is explicitly created for granting admin privileges, or
when Neutron is operating in noauth mode. In the latter case every
request is treated by neutron as an admin request, and get_admin_roles
is simply ensuring the appropriate roles get pushed into the context
so that the policy engine will grant admin rights to the request.
This behaviour is probably just a waste of resource; also it is not
adding anything from a security perspective.

On the other hand not performing checks when context.is_admin is
True should not pose a security threat either in noauth mode or
with the keystone middleware. In the former case the software keeps
operating assuming admin rights for every requests, whereas in the
latter case the keystone middleware will always supply a context
with the appropriate roles, and there is no way for an attacker
to trick keystonemiddleware into generating a context for which
is_admin=True.

Finally, this patch also does some non-trivial cheanges in test_l3.py

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-04-20 11:33:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove get_admin_roles and associated logic

get_admin_roles was introduced so that contextes generated from
within plugins could be used for policy checks. This was the case
up to the Havana release as several plugins invoked the policy
engine directly to authorize requests.

This was an incorrect behaviour and has now been fixed, meaning
that get_admin_roles is no longer need and can be safely removed.
This will result in a leaner and more reliable codebase. Indeed the
function being removed here was the cause of several bugs where the
policy engine was initialized too early in the server bootstrap
process.
While this patch removes the feaute is does not remove the
load_admin_roles parameter from context.get_admin_context. Doing so
will break other projects such as neutron-lbaas. The parameter is
preserved albeit ignored, and will be remove once projects consuming
neutron are adjusted accordingly.

As a consequence neutron's will now no longer perform policy checks
when context.is_admin=True. This flag is instead set either when
a context is explicitly created for granting admin privileges, or
when Neutron is operating in noauth mode. In the latter case every
request is treated by neutron as an admin request, and get_admin_roles
is simply ensuring the appropriate roles get pushed into the context
so that the policy engine will grant admin rights to the request.
This behaviour is probably just a waste of resource; also it is not
adding anything from a security perspective.

On the other hand not performing checks when context.is_admin is
True should not pose a security threat either in noauth mode or
with the keystone middleware. In the former case the software keeps
operating assuming admin rights for every requests, whereas in the
latter case the keystone middleware will always supply a context
with the appropriate roles, and there is no way for an attacker
to trick keystonemiddleware into generating a context for which
is_admin=True.

Finally, this patch also does some non-trivial changes in test_l3.py
as some tests where mocking context.to_dict ignoring the is_admin flag.

Partial-Bug: #1446021

commit_message:
Remove get_admin_roles and associated logic

get_admin_roles was introduced so that contextes generated from
within plugins could be used for policy checks. This was the case
up to the Havana release as several plugins invoked the policy
engine directly to authorize requests.

This was an incorrect behaviour and has now been fixed, meaning
that get_admin_roles is no longer need and can be safely removed.
This will result in a leaner and more reliable codebase. Indeed the
function being removed here was the cause of several bugs where the
policy engine was initialized too early in the server bootstrap
process.
While this patch removes the feature it does not remove the
load_admin_roles parameter from context.get_admin_context. Doing so
will break other projects such as neutron-lbaas. The parameter is
deprecated by this patch and an appropriate warning emitted.

As a consequence neutron's will now no longer perform policy checks
when context.is_admin=True. This flag is instead set either when
a context is explicitly created for granting admin privileges, or
when Neutron is operating in noauth mode. In the latter case every
request is treated by neutron as an admin request, and get_admin_roles
is simply ensuring the appropriate roles get pushed into the context
so that the policy engine will grant admin rights to the request.
This behaviour is probably just a waste of resource; also it is not
adding anything from a security perspective.

On the other hand not performing checks when context.is_admin is
True should not pose a security threat either in noauth mode or
with the keystone middleware. In the former case the software keeps
operating assuming admin rights for every requests, whereas in the
latter case the keystone middleware will always supply a context
with the appropriate roles, and there is no way for an attacker
to trick keystonemiddleware into generating a context for which
is_admin=True.

Finally, this patch also does some non-trivial changes in test_l3.py
as some tests were mocking context.to_dict ignoring the is_admin flag.

Closes-Bug: #1446021

Change-Id: I8a5c02712a0b43f3e36a4f14620ebbd73fbfb03f

commit_message:
Raise minimums for oslo libs without namespace packages

Update the minimum versions for several oslo libraries that no longer
use the namespace package.

The oslo.middleware version that dropped the namespace package is blocked
because it causes issues with our upgrade when the paste.ini files are
not upgraded when/before the code is upgraded.

Change-Id: I7ff3e9aaf7196efd8814e068b5dc52d1dd2ffe04
Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages

commit_message:
Ensure dependencies are present for dib image build

When using dib to build an image, the "Initiate image build" task
can fail if  dib-run-parts is not present. To make sure we have
dib-run-parts, install dib-utils as we do with other requirements.

Change-Id: I1fd9909fa278d8b2f829e3486e896a32b3ca1e25

commit_message:
Image Properties and License

Add to the schema properties that match what glance needs for importing
the image. Also some bits for quick searching by license, and a way to
specify how to lookup the license if it is not a well known one.

Change-Id: I9a6a0f87fe076d63af4259188476da65b3769475

commit_message:
Make nginx port configurable

This patch adds nginx_port var and uses it when setting up the nginx
service and for any reference to port 8080 when constructing links.
To change the port nginx uses pass --extra-vars "nginx_port=<port #>"

Change-Id: Ia06ef58544c3ef1308fcf42f1b9f0c168199f5f8

project creation tasks in gerrit failed. Fixing.

commit_message:
Use eventlet as wsgi server

Using eventlet instead of wsgi_server due to wsgi_server not
being production ready.  This is also the direction that other
projects, such as keystone and nova, use.

Removing cmd/builder.py with this patch (deprecated)

Change-Id: Ic77f43522e68b648839d2095c4f7745b33daeefd
Closes-bug: #1367470

commit_message:
Added check for jenkins and ci

It seems internal CI has an issue with host verifies, this patch has some logic around it.

This patch makes sure that the host verification is skipped allowing it
to continue.

Change-Id: Ie7786af583b88a96643dce682cd668ed326a5da3

commit_message:
Add DHCP documentation

Documentation for users who may wish to setup or utilize their own
DHCP server.

Included reference to DHCP document in the Ironic install role.

Made a note regarding the port numbers used in the code examples.

Removed space.

Removed space and changed maximum width of text.

Change-Id: Ib799f40b6db99610f982790d26be1eb5b0f14ab8
Co-Authored-By: Julia Kreger <juliaashleykreger@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Summer Barringer <yves.summer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support for disabling DHCP server configuration

The distinct possibility exists that a user may wish to utilize
a pre-existing dhcp server.  This is a first initial step to help
facilitate that use case.

Partial-Bug: #1459636
Change-Id: Icb45b1d50f29ad369d1473adbe4ae9f2e03fe5ae

commit_message:
Fix spec tests for RSpec 3.x and Puppet 4.x

Remove value testing (we only check the key here), the value is nil or undef
and fix resource array, according[1].

[1]https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/3.7.5/lib/puppet/resource.rb#L446-L453

Change-Id: Ic7a9b9d1e6d6b6b1c40fbce40d0bf9ff913f191e
Closes-bug: #1447620
